title: My wife and I are getting a divorce, but now she wants alimony.
question: My wife and I have been married for four years, and now we're getting a divorce. She now wants alimony, even though she makes more than I do, however she said that she'll just cut back on her hours so that it looks like I make more. She was illegal in this country before I married her, now after supporting her throughout the marriage she wants a divorce. Is there a way to not give her alimony, and still retain all of the marital assets, and perhaps gain alimony from her?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Alimony,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and alimony,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Family law
answers:
Alimony (spousal support here in CA) is a complex issue. A Court will base a request for temporary spousal support on a whole list of factors and will base longer-term spousal support on a whole additional list of factors. You need to sit down with a family law attorney and discuss all of the factors which are applicable to your situation.

In terms of division of community assets and debts (those acquired during the marriage with earnings and efforts), absent an agreement otherwise the Court is bound to divide the net value equally (that is, totalling the value of the assets, subtracting the total of the debts, and each of you should end up with some combination of assets and debts equal to one half that number. The specifics of who gets which assets and which debts, and whether you agree on the value of those, is a separate conversation to have with a lawyer).
